text: [Music]
greetings my name is Matt woods and I'm
here at the AWS headquarters in Seattle
to announce AWS Identity and Access
Management policy summaries our
customers have asked us for an easier
way to view the permissions that are
granted through iam polities customers
need this visibility for security and
compliance but don't want to review and
parse JSON policy documents to
understand the scope of their iam
permissions the new iam policy summaries
enable you to view the permissions that
are granted for your iam policies
without having to read jason policy
documents instead the iam policy
summaries feature provides you is simple
to read table of the services access
levels resources and conditions that are
defined in your iam policies you can use
iam policies summaries to audit your
policies track policies that grant
elevated permissions more closely and to
troubleshoot policies for example you
can see all the services that an iam
role has permissions to access or if an
iam user can modify the access level
permissions to an s3 bucket
iam policy summaries also let you review
new policies to ensure they grab the
permissions that you intended I am
policy some reasons available to all
customers and no additional charge you
can learn more on our website thanks a
lot
[Music]
